title: Aaron Pike (athlete)
text:
Aaron Pike (born 1985/1986) is an American athlete who competes in <a href="wheelchair%20racing">wheelchair racing</a>, <a href="biathlon">biathlon</a>, and <a href="cross-country%20skiing%20%28sport%29">cross-country skiing</a>. He has competed at the <a href="2012%20Summer%20Paralympics">2012</a>, <a href="2016%20Summer%20Paralympics">2016</a> and <a href="2020%20Summer%20Paralympics">2020 Summer Paralympics</a>, and the <a href="2014%20Winter%20Paralympics">2014</a> and <a href="2018%20Winter%20Paralympics">2018 Winter Paralympics</a>. Pike finished third at the <a href="2021%20Chicago%20Marathon">2021 Chicago Marathon</a>, and fourth at the <a href="2018%20New%20York%20City%20Marathon">2018</a> and <a href="2019%20New%20York%20City%20Marathon">2019 New York City Marathon</a>s as well as the <a href="2021%20Boston%20Marathon">2021 Boston Marathon</a>.
Personal life.
Pike is from <a href="Park%20Rapids%2C%20Minnesota">Park Rapids, Minnesota</a>, US. His father served in the military, and as a result, Pike grew up in four different US states, and spent time in Germany. He studied at <a href="Ramstein%20High%20School">Ramstein High School</a> in <a href="Kaiserslautern">Kaiserslautern</a>, Germany. At the age of 13, he was accidentally shot in a hunting accident in <a href="Virginia">Virginia</a>, US, which damaged his <a href="spinal%20cord">spinal cord</a>. He studied <a href="sociology">sociology</a> at the <a href="University%20of%20Illinois%20Urbana-Champaign">University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign</a>, and now lives in <a href="Champaign%2C%20Illinois">Champaign, Illinois</a>. Pike is in a relationship with Paralympian <a href="Oksana%20Masters">Oksana Masters</a>.
Career.
Wheelchair racing career.
Pike started <a href="wheelchair%20racing">wheelchair racing</a> in 2006, at the University of Illinois. He also participated in <a href="wheelchair%20basketball">wheelchair basketball</a>. At the <a href="2011%20IPC%20Athletics%20World%20Championships">2011 IPC Athletics World Championships</a>, he finished 26th and last in the heats of the <a href="2011%20IPC%20Athletics%20World%20Championships%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%201500%20metres">1,500 meters T54</a> event, and 19th overall in the <a href="2011%20IPC%20Athletics%20World%20Championships%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20marathon">marathon T54</a> race.
At the <a href="2012%20Summer%20Paralympics">2012 Summer Paralympics</a>, he came sixteenth in the <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%202012%20Summer%20Paralympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20marathon">marathon T54</a> event, and was eliminated in the heats of the <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%202012%20Summer%20Paralympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%201500%20metres%20T54">1,500 meters</a> and <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%202012%20Summer%20Paralympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%205000%20metres%20T54">5,000 meters</a> T54 events. He was part of the American team that finished sixth the 4 x 400 meters T53/54 relay. In 2013, he came second at the <a href="Twin%20Cities%20Marathon">Twin Cities Marathon</a>. He competed at the <a href="2014%20Chicago%20Marathon">2014 Chicago</a> and <a href="2014%20New%20York%20City%20Marathon">New York City Marathons</a>.
At the <a href="2016%20Summer%20Paralympics">2016 Summer Paralympics</a>, he came tenth in the <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%202016%20Summer%20Paralympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20marathon">marathon T54</a> event, in a time of 1:30:13. He was eliminated in the heats of the <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%202016%20Summer%20Paralympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%201500%20metres%20T54">1,500 meters T54</a> event. The same year, he finished second at the <a href="OneAmerica%20500%20Festival%20Mini-Marathon">OneAmerica 500 Festival Mini-Marathon</a>, behind winner <a href="Kim%20Gyu-dae">Kim Gyu-dae</a>. Pike came seventh at the <a href="2016%20London%20Marathon">2016 London Marathon</a> and eighth at the <a href="2016%20New%20York%20City%20Marathon">2016 New York City Marathon</a>. He came seventh again at the <a href="2017%20London%20Marathon">2017 London Marathon</a>, and fourth at the <a href="2018%20New%20York%20City%20Marathon">2018 New York City Marathon</a>. He finished ninth at the <a href="2019%20London%20Marathon">2019 London Marathon</a>, and fourth again at the <a href="2019%20New%20York%20City%20Marathon">2019 New York City Marathon</a>. In the same year, he came 10th in the <a href="2019%20World%20Para%20Athletics%20Championships%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%205000%20metres">5,000 meters T54</a> event at the <a href="2019%20World%20Para%20Athletics%20Championships">2019 World Para Athletics Championships</a>. He has won the <a href="Grandma%27s%20Marathon">Grandma's Marathon</a> on three occasions, and set a new course record of 1:20:59 in the 2019 race; he did not compete at the 2021 Grandma's Marathon, due to a scheduling clash.
In June 2021, he was selected in the American team for the delayed <a href="2020%20Summer%20Paralympics">2020 Summer Paralympics</a>, in the <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%202020%20Summer%20Paralympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20800%20metres%20T54">800 meters</a>, <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%202020%20Summer%20Paralympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%201500%20metres%20T54">1,500 meters</a> and <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%202020%20Summer%20Paralympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%205000%20metres%20T54">5,000 meters</a> T54 events. He had finished second to <a href="Daniel%20Romanchuk">Daniel Romanchuk</a> at the U.S. Paralympic Team Track and Field Trials in all three events earlier in the month, and was also selected for the <a href="Athletics%20at%20the%202020%20Summer%20Paralympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%20marathon%20T54">marathon T54</a> race. He came fifth in his 5,000 meters heat, and did not qualify for the final. He came ninth in his 1,500 meters heat, and did not qualify for the final. He came third in his 800 meters heat, and again did not qualify for the final. Pike came sixth in the marathon T54 race. Pike came fifth at the <a href="2021%20London%20Marathon">2021 London Marathon</a>. He competed at the 2021 <a href="2021%20Chicago%20Marathon">Chicago</a> and <a href="2021%20Boston%20Marathon">Boston Marathons</a> on consecutive days; the races were apart. He finished third overall in Chicago, and fourth in Boston.
Winter sports career.
After the 2012 Summer Paralympics, Pike took up <a href="skiing">skiing</a>, initially in order to take a break from wheelchair racing. He was invited to try skiing by a coach of the U.S. Paralympic Nordic Skiing National Team, and joined the US team in 2013. He now competes in <a href="biathlon">biathlon</a> and <a href="cross-country%20skiing%20%28sport%29">cross-country skiing</a>.
At the <a href="2014%20Winter%20Paralympics">2014 Winter Paralympics</a>, he competed in the <a href="Biathlon%20at%20the%202014%20Winter%20Paralympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%207.5%20kilometres">7.5 km</a> and <a href="Biathlon%20at%20the%202014%20Winter%20Paralympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%2015%20kilometres">15 km</a> sitting <a href="biathlon">biathlon</a> events, and the <a href="Cross-country%20skiing%20at%20the%202014%20Winter%20Paralympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%201%20km%20Sprint%20Classic">1 km sprint</a>, <a href="Cross-country%20skiing%20at%20the%202014%20Winter%20Paralympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%2010%20km">10 km</a> and <a href="Cross-country%20skiing%20at%20the%202014%20Winter%20Paralympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%2020%20km%20Free">15 km</a> <a href="Paralympic%20cross-country%20skiing">cross-country sit-skiing</a> races. He competed at the 2015 <a href="World%20Para%20Nordic%20Skiing%20Championships">World Para Nordic Skiing Championships</a> in <a href="Cable%2C%20Wisconsin">Cable, Wisconsin</a>, US. It was his first World Skiing Championship event.
He came fourth in the 15 km biathlon event at the 2017 World Para Nordic Skiing Championships. At the <a href="2018%20Winter%20Paralympics">2018 Winter Paralympics</a> in <a href="Pyeongchang">Pyeongchang</a>, he competed in the <a href="Biathlon%20at%20the%202018%20Winter%20Paralympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%207.5%20kilometres">7.5 km</a>, <a href="Biathlon%20at%20the%202018%20Winter%20Paralympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%2012.5%20kilometres">12.5 km</a> and <a href="Biathlon%20at%20the%202018%20Winter%20Paralympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%2015%20kilometres">15 km</a> sitting biathlon events, and the <a href="Cross-country%20skiing%20at%20the%202018%20Winter%20Paralympics%20%E2%80%93%20Men%27s%201.5%20km%20sprint%20classical">1.1 km</a> sitting cross-country sprint events. In the 15 km biathlon event, he succeeded in all 20 shots, and finished sixth overall. At the 2019 World Para Nordic Skiing Championships, Pike came third in the sprint biathlon event. At the <a href="2021%20World%20Para%20Snow%20Sports%20Championships">2021 World Para Snow Sports Championships</a>, Pike came second in the biathlon event.
